identity: Information describing who the person is — their background, values, personality, and preferences.
knowledge: Concepts, facts, or frameworks the person knows or references, including theories and learned material.
experience: Records of past actions or events — projects, achievements, failures, or roles that show what they have done.
intent: Statements of goals, plans, or questions — what the person wants, needs, or is trying to do next.
reflection: Self-assessment or insights — what was learned, how thinking evolved, or meta-level analysis.
